channel.title: Java.net JIRA
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [MSRP-56] Allow for multiple listeners on an MSRP session.
item.description:
Only 1 session listener is allowed per session.

It might be beneficial to allow for multiple listeners.
item.summary: Allow for multiple listeners on an MSRP session.

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [MSRP-55] RFC 3994, Add support for wrapped message composition.
item.description:
To support conference servers, the library has to be able to also handle message composition updates that are CPIM-wrapped.

This is currently not the case.

Extend the Session interface with a setActive(toAddress) call that CPIM-wraps the isComposing update.

Enhance incoming message validation to detect isComposing updates that are wrapped.
item.summary: RFC 3994, Add support for wrapped message composition.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
svn r 215 - also documented the solution in the tutorial.

Deployed 1.1.0-BETA-SNAPSHOT to Sonatype.

Ready for new release.

item.title: [MSRP-54] Inconsistent handling of character encoding (not always UTF-8)
item.description:
Code still contains implicit byte-array to string conversion and vice versa.
Default character encoding (not explicitly referring to UTF-8) varies per platform.
This can lead to special characters being inadvertently converted.
Code needs to be scanned for these implicit conversions.

Temporary workaround is to start your program/jvm with -Dfile.encoding="UTF-8".
item.summary: Inconsistent handling of character encoding (not always UTF-8)

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Refer to svn r200: UTF-8 all the way.

item.title: [MSRP-53] Boundary exceptions when message size just above 2048 - header-length.
item.description:
Transaction.getData() will generate an IndexOutOfBoundsException when the datachunk to get is just above 2048 - header length.

Sending that message will fail.
item.summary: Boundary exceptions when message size just above 2048 - header-length.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
• method now computes correct offset.
  • addition of boundary regression test
    (svn r191).

item.title: [MSRP-52] server socket creation not threadsafe
item.description:
When called by different threads, Stack.getConnectionsInstance() can return multiple Connections instances for the same address.
This should not happen.
item.summary: server socket creation not threadsafe

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Refer to svn r189: synchronized get-method and tested resulting behaviour.

item.title: [MSRP-51] Not all messages are immediately sent from the session queue.
item.description:
Session.triggerSending() only readies the top message for sending.
It should do that for all messaages currently in the queue.
item.summary: Not all messages are immediately sent from the session queue.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Refer to svn r.185 - patch to send all queued messages checked in.

item.title: [MSRP-50] Aborting a message that's already been sent is not an error.
item.description:
When a message has been sent and the receiver has a problem parsing, a 400 response can result.
This leads to an abort of the outgoing message where a sanity check throws an exception when the outgoing message was already completed.

Given the use-case, this is perfectly normal though. The exception shouldn't be thrown.
item.summary: Aborting a message that's already been sent is not an error.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Refer to svn r184:

  • removed isComplete() check from OutgoingMessage.abort().
  • Some refactored code (simplification).

item.title: [MSRP-49] session.addToPath() is a misnomer. No runtime sanity checks in place.
item.description:
The methodname session.addToPath() suggests it can be called repeatedly when this is not the case.
It actually completes and initialises the session.

Calling it a second time will halt the stack so it needs a sanity check.
item.summary: session.addToPath() is a misnomer. No runtime sanity checks in place.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Refer to svn r183.
addToPath() now obsolete.
Replaced by setToPath().
Added sanity check.
Changed tutorial documentation.
Get into bug-fix release.

item.title: [MSRP-48] No public interface for changing status-report settings on a message.
item.description:
Currently, there is no easy way to change status-report settings on messages that have been created as the are immediately put into the send queue.
All one can do is create messages and set the status-report but only before the connection is completed.

This should be changed.

I suggest a new session.sendMessage() convenience method with extra parameters that allow to set the status-report headings.
item.summary: No public interface for changing status-report settings on a message.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Refer to svn r 186:
Message code has been refactored, interface changed.

You can now create an OutgoingMessage, modify it and choose to send it over any session.

item.title: [MSRP-47] Support for MSRP bodiless SEND requests.
item.description:
According RFC it should be possible to send MSRP SEND requests without a body.

This for keep-alive and NAT purposes.
It currently doesn't work, is not tested, nor supported.

It should be implemented.
item.summary: Support for MSRP bodiless SEND requests.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: It's not only for NAT purposes, but also for connection re-use and, in the use case, that might not be supported, of establishing a session without already having a message to send. So, the first SEND validates the session. So, in cases where you establish a session first and then take a relatively long time to send a MESSAGE, if the other peer tidies up regularly, the negotiated session might not be valid..

Resolved in svn 170.

Includes a bit of tutorial on how to use.
Fixed in wrong version, move to proper version.
Now registered in correct version.

item.title: [MSRP-46] Support for RFC 3994: Indication of Message Composition for IM.
item.description: Support for sending and receiving of content-type: application/im-iscomposing+xml for status updates within the MSRP message flow.
item.summary: Support for RFC 3994: Indication of Message Composition for IM.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Completed support with last update (r160).

item.title: [MSRP-45] Support for secure connections (msrps)
item.description:
Currently, no special code is in place to support TCP connections protected by TLS.

Thus, using the "msrps" scheme is not supported/tested.

Code and tests should be put in place to support this and make the lib fully RFC4975 compliant.
item.summary: Support for secure connections (msrps)

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [MSRP-44] Support for RFC 4976: MSRP Relay Extensions.
item.description:
Extend the library and interface to enable developers to also use MSRP in implemeting relay functionality.
This entails:

  • Supporting the AUTH method.
  • Support forwarding requests.
  • Support for finding MSRP relays.
item.summary: Support for RFC 4976: MSRP Relay Extensions.

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [MSRP-43] Produce documentation on how to use this library.
item.description:
Currently, the library is only documented with Javadoc-style comment in combination with sample code.
Although fairly complete, not very user-friendly.

We need to produce some sort of how-to or tutorial to quickly introduce new users to this lib.
This should be done while also resolving issue 27 (API definition).
item.summary: Produce documentation on how to use this library.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Resolved witt svn r140-146.
We now have a tutorial.

item.title: [MSRP-42] Session of an active connection cannot receive messages.
item.description:
Sessions, established with an active connection, cannot receive messages because they are omitted in the activeSessions storage of the stack.

There is also nothing that tests this.
item.summary: Session of an active connection cannot receive messages.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
See svn r. 83 and 84.

An active connection now immediately registers an active session.

item.title: [MSRP-41] A generated message-id can contain illegal characters.
item.description:
The utility-routine to generate a message-id can use the MAC-address.
This however is not properly converted to an ident:

the construction: new String(macAddress); needs to change.
item.summary: A generated message-id can contain illegal characters.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Solved in svn r51.
Patch & Tests Ok.

item.title: [MSRP-40] Queued session messages are not sent.
item.description:
Messages queued in a session that is not completely established yet are not send after setup.

Attached a patch that will trigger sending of these messages once setup.

Please review and apply.

TIA,
Tom.
item.summary: Queued session messages are not sent.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: See svn r48: patch applied.
Patch Ok, test added, tests Ok.

item.title: [MSRP-39] Support Maven as build tool.
item.description:
It would be nice if the library could be compiled/tested/installed using Maven.

Thus, other Maven-based projects can easily include this library, extending its usability/ease of use.

It will basically only involve some re-structuring of the directory-tree and producing a POM.

Furthermore, versions of this library can then be included in the/a online repository.
Not sure whether java.net has/supports one. To be researched.
item.summary: Support Maven as build tool.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
A suitable pom.xml has been built.
Uploads/Releases can now be done via oss.sonatype.org.

Refer to https://docs.sonatype.org/display/Repository/Sonatype+OSS+Maven+Repository+Usage+Guide on how this is (can be) done.

We just had a successful release of 1.0.1.BETA, this issue can be closed.

item.title: [MSRP-38] Add support for CPIM
item.description:
According chapter 13 of RFC 4975, MSRP should be able to support gatewaying messages using CPIM.

It would be nice to have this functionality (wrapping and unwrapping of IM's) supported in this library, hence this request/issue.
item.summary: Add support for CPIM

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: r147 completes this implemetnation.

item.title: [MSRP-37] Refactor Report classes.
item.description:
Refactoring hint/request:
The classes FailureReport and SuccessReport contain a lot of duplicated code in their respective constructors.

The code could be refactored (improved) by moving most of the constructing to the ReportTransaction class.
item.summary: Refactor Report classes.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Refer to svn r63, classes refactored.
Refactoring done, tests Ok.

item.title: [MSRP-36] Cannot send failure report, contructor error
item.description:
The wrong fields (and types) are compared in costructing a failure report.

Thus, a failure report cannot always be sent.

Attached a patch to compare the proper fields.

Please review and apply.

TIA,
Tom.
item.summary: Cannot send failure report, contructor error

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Modified constructor code.
Another bug in the constructor (no initialisation of direction) is also patched in this patchfile.

And a third bug in constructing a failure report.
No proper status-commnet catenation when comment given.

Also in this patch

And another bug in constructor.
Catenate comment properly (when given).

Also patched.
See svn r47: patch applied.
Patch Ok.

item.title: [MSRP-35] TransactionType obscufation in Connection.parser()
item.description:
The parser method contains a very roundabout way of setting the TransactionType enum value.

Attached a patch to simplify code.

Please review and apply.

TIA,
Tom.
item.summary: TransactionType obscufation in Connection.parser()

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: See svn r46: patch applied
Patch Ok.

item.title: [MSRP-34] No session association on receiving (server) end.
item.description:
Usecase:
UAS receives an INVITE for MSRP and binds a socket waiting for the subsequent TCP connection and initial SEND.

Reception of the initial SEND doesn't find the associated session and a 481 response is sent where a 200 response is in order.
The session isn't found because the Connections-set is improperly searched. The local address should be used for that, not the remote address.

Attached a patch to search for the proper session.

Please review and apply.

TIA,
Tom.
item.summary: No session association on receiving (server) end.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: See svn r46: patch applied.
Patch = Ok, can be closed.

item.title: [MSRP-33] Creation of a new Connections object with wrong IP-address results in infinite loop.
item.description:
Specifying the wrong IP address on creating a Connections object results in an endless loop trying to bind the socket.

The bind with the random port fails whereafter a next port is tried.
But the port is not the problem, the address is.

Attached a patch that leaves the picking of an available port to the system (via JVM).
Please review and apply.

TIA,
Tom.

Note that the Connection class seems to have the same construct (no patch available).
item.summary: Creation of a new Connections object with wrong IP-address results in infinite loop.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
See svn r45.

Connection class still to investigate so we keep the issue open.

See svn r49.

Also patched Connection class.
Patches work, can be closed.

item.title: [MSRP-32] Performance and profiling (was: ...related Bug, missed wakeup on the writing thread, finding and killing).
item.description:
Examining the Performance test results.xlsx one can identify a possible bug that
could explain the Max-min fluctiations ~2000 ms between several runs of the same
tests.

This can be related with a lack of waking up the writing thread of the connection.
item.summary: Performance and profiling (was: ...related Bug, missed wakeup on the writing thread, finding and killing).

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Identified a place where the writing thread wasn't notified (in the
generateTransactionsToSend of TransactionManager).

Still yet to be determined if this solves the problem. A new set of performance
tests should solve the situation.

done in r38

This is not a bug but an improvement.

We should have documented and automated profiling tests though.
From there we can determine any bottlenecks.

Impact for v1 is expected to be minimal so we delay this to v2.
More details about these tests can be found in my dissertation, here: http://web.ist.utl.pt/~joao.a.p.antunes/?page_id=39 at page 65 (pg 68 start the details about the performance tests)
Some bug-fixes and performance improvements obsoleted this issue, therefore can be closed.
See resolve.

item.title: [MSRP-31] Allow connection reuse and sharing by the sessions
item.description:
As described in the connection model, make sure that connection re-usage and
sharing is supported and that the actual behaviour and socket allocations promote
connection reusage.
item.summary: Allow connection reuse and sharing by the sessions

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [MSRP-30] Session.tearDown() - Release the resources
item.description:
Solution directions/suggestions:
.Release the resources maybe with a timer to await receiving transaction
responses/REPORT requests and then close the connection if no other session is
using it.

.If meanwhile an illegal request is received (illegal due to the fact that the
session is not being used anymore, automaticly respond accordingly)
item.summary: Session.tearDown() - Release the resources

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment: Let's pass this issue to version2 since we have no connection reuse so far.

item.title: [MSRP-29] Support for comments in the transaction responses and Status headers of reports
item.description:
Support for comments in the transaction responses and Status headers of reports.

The optional comment of these two items isn't currently supported. Roadmap:

Create the appropriate regular expressions patterns in the MSRPRegexFactory and
make tests to assert that they are correctly recognised.

Support for sending comments and asserting that they are correctly received
item.summary: Support for comments in the transaction responses and Status headers of reports

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Resolved with svn r 75.

Comment is now included.

item.title: [MSRP-28] Why the TestAbortMechanism.Java tends to fail on the abort test with an excess of 75578 bytes
item.description:
Assert exactly why the tendency to have 75578 bytes more when the buffers are 2048
buffers long.
Is it thread related? quickfixed with an extra tolerance
item.summary: Why the TestAbortMechanism.Java tends to fail on the abort test with an excess of 75578 bytes

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Apparently it doesn't happen anymore, there were lots of refactors done by tom, therefore this issue might have been solved

item.title: [MSRP-27] Make a clear distinction between the methods and classes that should be used by the user and those that he shouldn't touch
item.description: Make it clearer, implementing public interfaces for instance
item.summary: Make a clear distinction between the methods and classes that should be used by the user and those that he shouldn't touch

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Resolved with svn 140-145.

item.title: [MSRP-26] Extending the API so that is possible to abort an incoming and outgoing message
item.description:
Make the API call the AbortedMessageEvent when 4XX responses that mean that the
message was aborted are detected
item.summary: Extending the API so that is possible to abort an incoming and outgoing message

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Altered the API so that it accepts incoming and outgoing message abortions with
several reason associated.

TODO:

Method to abort incoming messages (the receiver sends a r413 response)
Detect the responses that lead to an abort event and fire it (the sender
receives one response or REPORT that equals a response [namespace 000] of:
400
403
413
415
481)

Done on r36
Done in r38. Also added a test on TestAbortMechanism

item.title: [MSRP-25] Uninterruptible condition in Transaction constructor wrong
item.description:
As kindly pointed out by Christophe:
"I don't understand the condition according to which you mark a transaction as
interruptible :

if (headerBytes.length + (message.getSize() - message.bytesSent())
+ (7 + tID.length() + 1) > MSRPStack.MAXIMUMUNINTERRUPTIBLE)

In fact for me you shouldn't take into account the headerBytes length (as well
as the boundary) because a transaction is interruptible if the size of the chunk
is greater than 2048 and by size of chunk we mean the data ?
[...]
shouldn't it simply be if ((message.getSize() - message.bytesSent()) >
MSRPStack.MAXIMUMUNINTERRUPTIBLE) ?"

Yes it should! will fix this only after figuring out and solving MSRP-24 so that
bugs don't accumulate. Also this will probably will require me to fix the
TestAbortMechanism and do task 23
item.summary: Uninterruptible condition in Transaction constructor wrong

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Added the issue dependencies
Going to set all the transactions as interruptible
Going to remove the condition making all the transactions interruptible
All of the transactions are interruptible now, solved in r39

item.title: [MSRP-24] Connection.PreParser smallbuffer sometimes is overflowed
item.description:
This shouldn't happen and it might started happening due to recent changes to the
preParser algorithm. Although making the buffer bigger than it's 44 bytes
apparently corrects the situation, the causes still need to be asserted as this
shouldn't happen with the 44 bytes.
item.summary: Connection.PreParser smallbuffer sometimes is overflowed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Strangely works sometimes, added a special catch for BufferOverflowExceptions in
the Connection.PreParser, that will log more information if this error occurs
again

Resolved by r128/129.

Code did the wrong calculations, tried to stuff any remaining data in pre-pend buffer.

Corrected.

item.title: [MSRP-23] Correcting sent data, checking that the transaction ID isn't in the body of a small uninterruptible message
item.description:
Check what the stack does in case the body of the message is less than 2048 bytes
and it finds the tid. Fill an Issue if incorrect behaviour is perceived and
correct it in one of various ways:
. checking the whole body of the message on transactions that aren't interruptible
. make all the transactions interruptible
. etc.
item.summary: Correcting sent data, checking that the transaction ID isn't in the body of a small uninterruptible message

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Not needed, going to make all of the transactions interruptible

item.title: [MSRP-22] Memory optimisation - Correct Java Heap Space problems
item.description:
when sending big files currently we have problems with Java Heap space, running
a profiler shows that the major memory consumptions come from:
(Active size)
. A short[], although the profiler isn't very helpful, this must be from the
Counter, so, solving Issue #18 should solve this Issue as well.

We have problems with a file being sent of

243.809.310 bytes

the short[] active space consumption is roughly twice the size of the file being
sent
item.summary: Memory optimisation - Correct Java Heap Space problems

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Added the dependency to Issue #18 and started solving it

Solved, currently has no grand efficiency issues and transmits even big files in
acceptable (but still can probably be in an even shorter) time

done with r35

item.title: [MSRP-21] Add a TransactionListener that allows complete control over the transactions
item.description:
Add a new class that gets notified upon transaction parsing (complete headers)
that allows an application to deal with each Transaction Request and Responses
associated with a Session
item.summary: Add a TransactionListener that allows complete control over the transactions

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [MSRP-20] Support for all the major Java logging systems
item.description: Made with the use of a meta logging system called SLF4J.
item.summary: Support for all the major Java logging systems

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Accomplished through the use of a meta logging system called SLF4J
(http://www.slf4j.org/) integrated @ r32

item.title: [MSRP-19] Pre Parser algorithm failure on resetting state
item.description:
There was an error, when the parserStates was > 0 and it was reset to zero, a
character was erroneously consumed, therefore making possible to miss the first
sequence of end-line or start of content stuff (although in the content stuff it's
harder to happen because theoretically you won't have unuseful \r\n )
item.summary: Pre Parser algorithm failure on resetting state

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Solved! on r32

The problem was that a character was consumed when the state was reset, now that
doesn't occur.

item.title: [MSRP-18] Replace the use of short arrays in the Counter with bitset
item.description:
Things to gain with this:

. Less space used
. Counter can then have a maximum limit of long
. Performance
item.summary: Replace the use of short arrays in the Counter with bitset

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Done but it was very slow, so now this option is abandoned in favor of an
ArrayList with a representation of the clusters of reported bytes that got
received.. more details in Counter.java

item.title: [MSRP-17] Parsers not giving enough feedback and validation - redesing needed
item.description:
Redesigning the Parses so that they validate the parsed data and headers in a way
that will allow for better response codes and allow finding errors more easily.
item.summary: Parsers not giving enough feedback and validation - redesing needed

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [MSRP-16] Make the parsers and patterns comply with MSRP formal syntax
item.description:
As an example, the content stuff pattern matcher doesn't exactly comply to the
token defined in MSRP RFC.

Make all of the parser patterns comply.
When setting values that are specified on the RFC such as content-type and others,
make sure that they comply to the RFC's formal syntax, otherwise, send an
exception, avoids incorrect use and parsers misfunction
item.summary: Make the parsers and patterns comply with MSRP formal syntax

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment:
A class with the Regex patterns complying with the RFC is being devised and
developed

The "token" of the MSRP's RFC formal syntax complies, but the rest is still needed
to be done. progress made on r32

As pointed out by uijltje, we are not accepting the transaction ids as we should (as specified in sect 9 [the ABNF] of the MSRP RFC). The transaction-id should be somehting like:

transact-id = ident
ident = ALPHANUM 3*31ident-char
ident-char = ALPHANUM / "." / "-" / "+" / "%" / "="
ALPHANUM = ALPHA / DIGIT

and going back to the ABNF RFC (RFC 4234) one learns, as expected, that:

ALPHA = %x41-5A / %x61-7A ; A-Z / a-z
DIGIT = %x30-39
; 0-9

But "we are not allowing the ". - +%=" chars to be on the incoming transaction, and we are expecting a minimum of 8 chars in there (instead of the minimum of 4"

So this should be corrected (using a test with the TID in the extremes should do the trick to keep this code TDD tidy

Regarding the recently found problem related with the Transaction ID

Seen that this is TDD (and that i think that is a key methodology to make sure that nothing breaks in the future). The way to go about this is to make a simple test, with the extreme values, i.e. a Transaction ID of:
3 valid chars - which must fail (as the minimum is 4);
4 or more chars but the first char one of the special ones [". - +%="] - which must fail, as the first must be an ALPHA NUM one;
33 valid chars - which must fail because the limit is 32;
4 valid chars, with one or more special ones - which must work as the size and the chars are ok;

and then correct the patterns found in line ~1152 (phew, a lot of lines, I wrote a bit of a messy code back then) to make sure that the test complies. Making sure that the test fails and gives the appropriate and expected response would also be very useful.

item.title: [MSRP-15] TestReportMechanism waiting on the wrong objects
item.description:
Make the TestReportMechanism tests wait on the correct objects,
for instance, the successReportCounter and the updateSendStatusCounter
item.summary: TestReportMechanism waiting on the wrong objects

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Bascily, the test works, this would be an improvement

For now, It won't be done, the test works, I think that the original idea was to actually have a more synched test were instead of seeing in the end if the number of reports where correct, actually transmit X% of data, and wait that the report was received. But it works as is, IMO

item.title: [MSRP-14] When some tests run the transaction responses don't get sent
item.description:
This occurs because the Connection Write thread is sleeping for two seconds.

Solution directions:
When adding transactions to send, wake up / notify the Write thread
item.summary: When some tests run the transaction responses don't get sent

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Fixed with revision 30.

Basicly now we notify the write thread everytime we add a transaction to send on
the TransactionManager

item.title: [MSRP-13] Creation of an example of usage with two distinct endpoints
item.description:
from the e-mail:
"Hi !

Thanks for your interest.

For the moment, we don't use your implementation of the msrp stack. In fact, we
have difficulties to use it for us project.

We can't send msrp message between 2 distinct machines, the stack work fine in
localhost but not between 2 PC

It's obscur for us. How use it ?

Thanks !
"
item.summary: Creation of an example of usage with two distinct endpoints

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Added the UsingLibraryByTwoNetworkEndpoints.java in the examples package

item.title: [MSRP-12] TestCorrectlyBreaksSentData.java enhancement
item.description:
Enhance TestCorrectlyBreaksSentData.java test to verify that the message is
correctly broken into transactions in the case of:
. A big message is to be transmitted;
. The transaction end-line occurs when the write buffer changes so that half of
it should be on one buffer and the other half on the other 2048 bytes buffer
.The transaction end-line occurs completely on the first character of the new
2048 byte write buffer
item.summary: TestCorrectlyBreaksSentData.java enhancement

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
page 18 of RFC 4975:
<<<<<
If the request contains a body, the sender MUST ensure that the end-
line (seven hyphens, the transaction identifier, and a continuation
flag) is not present in the body. If the end-line is present in the
body, the sender MUST choose a new transaction identifier that is not
present in the body, and add a CRLF if needed, and the end-line,
including the "$", "#", or "+" character
>>>>>

Is not properly tested (yet), test is ignored for now.

Uncertain whether issue is handled correctly nor if it'll present problems in usage.
Delay fix to version 2 for now.

Refer to svn r182 for a solution.

Especially the interrupt of a transaction was improved by generating a new one and queueing when it was interrupted.

Unit tests on break now function.

Issue can be closed
Get into bug-fix release....

item.title: [MSRP-11] Validate and add the possibility to send multiple messages per Session and also to allow the Session establishment without messages to send
item.description:
The library was designed having this feature in mind, however, this
functionality wasn't completely implemented and tested
item.summary: Validate and add the possibility to send multiple messages per Session and also to allow the Session establishment without messages to send

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Confirmed by a recent contribution that the stack doesn't yet send multiple
messages. Solving this shouldn't be hard though. Either/or:
. Replacing the messageBeingSent reference in the TransactionManager and call the
TransactionManager.generateTransactionsToSend()when a message is sent.
.Change the TransactionManager.generateTransactionsToSend() so that it puts in
queue one transasction for each of the messages its sessions have to send,
therefore no intermediate call to the
TransactionManager.generateTransactionsToSend()is needed, unless messages are
added or removed from the list of messages to be sent, or the session or sessions
get unbound by any reason from the TransactionManager.

As far as I can see, the library currently supports that functionality.

Hence we can close this issue.

item.title: [MSRP-10] duplicate success REPORT of completely sent and received message.
item.description:
This kind of behavior isn't incompatible with the one present on the standards
as far as i know, so by now it is given the lowest priority.

This Issue was found when resolving issues 2 and 3.
item.summary: duplicate success REPORT of completely sent and received message.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Solved with r37

item.title: [MSRP-9] Extra Session URI validation.
item.description:
Specifics: Although as far as I can tell, itâ€™s not required for an endpoint to
do so, it probably would be good and add value as an extra security measure, to
confirm that the adjacent endpointâ€™s URIâ€™s address stated on the â€˜From-Path:â€™
session URI is actually coming from the host that is on the URI.
Solution directions: In order to do this, one might need to do some reverse DNS
lookups, that in case of failure shouldnâ€™t contribute to the decision of
accepting or not the incoming connection/session.
item.summary: Extra Session URI validation.

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [MSRP-8] Message-ID uniqueness not that unique.
item.description:
Specifics: Although message uniqueness is guaranteed in a per Session basis, it
should be guaranteed , as stated on RFC 4975, that the Message-ID should be
highly unlikely to be repeated by the generating host or even another host in
the future. In my defence this was a quick and viable way of doing this and
implements the advice given on the rfc for endpoints without onboard clock, and
reuses code that I had successfully wrote and working for the generation of the
session id.
Solution directions: Assert methodâ€™s generation advice on RFC 4975 feasability,
and implement it or some method alike. Feasability depends mostly on the
retrieval of the MAC address by the Java VM.
item.summary: Message-ID uniqueness not that unique.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Fixed in rev. 44

item.title: [MSRP-7] Validation of sent data issue.
item.description:
Specifics: There is a major flaw on the sending of the data, I have noticed that
a required/mandatory and very important requirement isnâ€™t fulfilled. This is the
one that states that the sent data should be checked for the existence of
characters on the body of the message that could be present on the message
content that could be equal and therefore confused as with the transaction end-
line field.
Solution directions: Check for those characters on the content while parsing
them to the stack and if a piece of content is found that could be interpreted
as the end-line we should .pause() the message and generate a new transaction.
Also write some tests to assert that his behavior is being checked for.
item.summary: Validation of sent data issue.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
This Issue is being solved before the 5th due to the fact that it may require
changing some of the most important parts that affect performance to be changed,
therefore it makes more sense to correct this one first.
*Correction on the last comment, it should be done before issue 6th not 5th

Solved! however the newly added test that tests for this subject can be improved
and made more effective, see Issue #12 for more details
Solved on revision 32
Disregard the "Solved on revision 32" comment, was meant to Issue #6

item.title: [MSRP-6] Performance issue.
item.description:
Specifics: As it can be tested with the TestSendingMessages class, there is a
performance issue on the FileToMemory tests or FileToFile tests. Also on Windows
Vista + JDK 1.6.X I had a performance issue that didnâ€™t existed on Win XP
Solution directions: The culprit of such performance loss should be the way how
I get the data from the file with the dataContainer and the writeCycle of the
connection (the TransactionManager.get() that calls FileDataContainer.get()
method represents too much of an overhead getting byte by byte the file
content).
However I will test the application with a profiler to make sure that the
suspects are indeed the ones to blame for and revise the retrieval of the data
taking into consideration Issue #7
item.summary: Performance issue.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Altered the dependencies.

It's best to do before Issue #7 and then optimize the performance.

Solved Issue #6, performance issue. Screenshots of the differences can be seen on
the Project Definition .mmap
Performance issues solved by bulk reading data to be sent in the writeCycle.
Some code cleanup is lacking, some deprecated methods can probably be deleted.
Changed the TestReportMechanism so that it tolerates percentage skewes on the
updateSendStatus call due to the fact that the granularity of the calls to it
aren't byte by byte but must tolerate Connection.OUTPUTBUFFERLENGTH (2048bytes)
differences
Solved on revision 32

item.title: [MSRP-5] Parsers misbehaving.
item.description:
Specifics: I have reasons to suspect, more specificly I think that issue #17 of
the SC file integration project, is due to some misbehavior of the parsers on
the MSRP Stack.
Solution directions: Having the parsers (Transaction and Connection) extensively
and thoroughly tested in all situations with JUnit tests that would require me
to build some Mock Classes. Also revise the code and refactor it so that it
becomes more legible.
item.summary: Parsers misbehaving.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
[Extracted from the GSoC 2008 report, Issue 17 referred to on the description]

  • Starting of Issue -
    17) Notification of file transfer success not working/lacking.
    Specifics: The underlying file transfer executed by the MSRP is done using a
    Message whose success report is set to yes, so that the sender should be
    informed by the receiver upon successful receiving of the complete message.
    However this behavior wasnâ€™t registered when I sent the build.xml of sip
    communicator from a SC client to another, I suspect the culprit here is the
    parser of the MSRP Stack (Issue #5 of the MSRP Stack implementation)
  • End of Issue -

Although i found the probable bug that made this Issue come to life and solved
it on the process of solving Issues #2 and #3 with the TestReportMechanism.java.
It seems a good idea to make some extensive tests to the parses in order to have
a good base of tests to validate the parsers from now on.

It's best to leave this for later because the way the parsers operate should be
restructured by the Issue #6.

Also i have some doubts that i need more validation for the parsers, because
Issue 17 of the Sip-Communicator is solved with the solving of issues #2 and #3
and already exists the TestTransaction class that test the Parsers of the
Transaction. Maybe after the fixing of the Issue #6 i should create the Tests
for the Parsers of the connection

item.title: [MSRP-4] Lacking: Message abortion â€“ abort a message being sent and have the API notify whoever is listening through another MSRPSessionListener method.
item.description:
ïƒ˜ Oddly enough this functionality isnâ€™t implemented yet.
ïƒ˜ Known Issues/Bugs
4) The lack of this functionality is considered a bug/important issue.
item.summary: Lacking: Message abortion â€“ abort a message being sent and have the API notify whoever is listening through another MSRPSessionListener method.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Started work on this Issue.

To fully implement this functionality we need to fix Issue #11 and after get
back to the tests and make sure that for example the abortion of unset messages
is working

Feature added!

Created the method Message.abortSend()
and made the TestAbortMessage class to validate the implemented functions.

*Correction,
the name of the test class is TestAbortMechanism

item.title: [MSRP-3] Validation/Tests lacking of Support for reporting sent bytes on a customizable manner.
item.description:
3) Not completely validated.
Specifics: There must be tests on this functionality purely as a good
programming principle and to eventually do modifications to the source without
worrying too much about breaking functionalities, however there are no
suspicions that this functionality is working badly like the success report one.
item.summary: Validation/Tests lacking of Support for reporting sent bytes on a customizable manner.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
This issue and Issue #2 where resolved with the TestReportMechanism that
identified some bugs on the code concerning the REPORT mechanism and the
updateSendStatus

item.title: [MSRP-2] Validation/Tests for the Support for different granularities of the Success Reports
item.description:
4. Support for different granularities of the Success Reports (those are
only required to be given if Success-Report field is set to yes and mandatory
only when completely received a message, however they can be used as ACKs of
chunks of messages for effects of filling the progress bar smoothly and
accurately on a file transfer)
ïƒ˜ Implemented with issues.
â€¢ Classes: MSRPSessionListener receivedReport method.
ReportMechanism abstract class.
DefaultReportMechanism concrete class.
ïƒ˜ Known Issues/bugs:
2) Not completely validated.
Specifics: There is a simple test that validates the Default Report mechanism
however no tests where made in which one tries to change the Report Mechanism
and I have reasons to believe that a problem with the parser exists that renders
the reception of some success reports useless see Issue #17 on the SC file
integration.
item.summary: Validation/Tests for the Support for different granularities of the Success Reports

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Started to implement the tests and the alternative report mechanism to
thoroughly validate this feature.

This issue and Issue #3 where resolved with the TestReportMechanism that
identified some bugs on the code concerning the REPORT mechanism and the
updateSendStatus

item.title: [MSRP-1] Inability to transfer binary data.
item.description:
Specifics: This is due to the fact that all data is parsed as a us-ascii string.
Comments: should be very easy to fix, two solution directions possible here: do
not set all the data to be parsed as a string and actually check for start and
end of headers and continuation flags or play around with the charsetdecoder
class.
item.summary: Inability to transfer binary data.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Resolved! However took a little bit more time than expected (it seems that it
always does, this isn't the worst) and added a tiny bit of complexity to the
code.
Changed the subcomponent of the issue
